questions.text: Woman presents with 10 weeks POG and wants medical termination of pregnancy what will you give
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Mifepristone and misoprostol is the correct answer.

Mifepristone and Misoprostol Combination: This is the gold standard and most effective regimen for medical abortion, particularly for pregnancies up to 10-12 weeks of gestation.
Mifepristone: This is an antiprogestin. It blocks the action of progesterone, which is essential for maintaining pregnancy. By blocking progesterone, it causes decidual degeneration, detachment of the gestational sac, and softening of the cervix.
Misoprostol: This is a prostaglandin E1 (PGE1) analogue. It causes uterine contractions and cervical ripening, leading to the expulsion of the pregnancy. Misoprostol is typically administered 24-48 hours after mifepristone.
Efficacy: The combination of mifepristone followed by misoprostol has a high success rate (over 95%) for complete medical abortion in the first trimester.

B. Dinoprostone is incorrect. Dinoprostone is a prostaglandin E2 (PGE2) analogue. While it causes cervical ripening and uterine contractions and can be used for induction of labor or termination of pregnancy, it is generally less effective than misoprostol for medical abortion in the first trimester and is more commonly used in the second trimester for induction or cervical ripening before labor induction at term. It is not the preferred or most common single agent for first-trimester medical termination.

C. Oxytocin is incorrect. Oxytocin is a uterotonic agent primarily used to induce or augment labor in the second and third trimesters or to manage postpartum hemorrhage. It is ineffective as a standalone agent for termination in the first trimester because the uterus at 10 weeks is relatively insensitive to oxytocin. The uterus becomes more responsive to oxytocin as pregnancy advances.

D. Intrauterine hyperosmolar saline is incorrect. Intrauterine instillation of hyperosmolar saline was an older method of abortion, primarily used for later-trimester abortions (second trimester). It is associated with significant risks, including infection, coagulopathy, and retained placental tissue, and has largely been replaced by prostaglandin analogues or surgical methods. It is not used for first-trimester termination.

questions.text: Previous CS in labour 8cm dilated station at -1with fetal bradycardia and maternal tachycardia what is management
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Em CS In a woman with a previous cesarean delivery now in labor with suspicious signs like fetal bradycardia and maternal tachycardia, the first concern is uterine rupture—a potentially catastrophic complication in a scarred uterus. Uterine rupture can present with non-reassuring fetal heart rate patterns (like bradycardia), maternal tachycardia (due to pain or bleeding), and loss of station. Since the cervix is not fully dilated (8 cm) and the head is still high (-1 station), a vaginal delivery is not imminent, and immediate emergency cesarean section is indicated to prevent fetal and maternal morbidity or mortality.

questions.text: History of prolapse which ligament is main support
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Mackenrodt The Mackenrodt ligament, also known as the transverse cervical ligament, is the primary structural support of the uterus. It extends from the cervix and lateral vaginal fornices to the lateral pelvic wall and acts as the main horizontal support for the uterus. It anchors the cervix and upper vagina in position, preventing uterine descent. Weakening or damage to this ligament—commonly due to childbirth trauma, aging, or increased intra-abdominal pressure—is a major contributor to uterine prolapse.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with altered sensorium, hypotension and breathlessness. ABG -pH 7.22, co2-44 Hco3-16 chloride is 84 Na is 130 paO2-58. Base deficit is -12. Acid base disorder here is

questions.text: Hydroureteronephrosis stage of cervical cancer
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) 3b According to the FIGO (International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics) staging system, Stage 3B cervical cancer is defined by tumor extension to the pelvic wall and/or causing hydronephrosis or non-functioning kidney. Hydroureteronephrosis results from tumor compressing or infiltrating the ureter, leading to urinary tract obstruction. The presence of hydronephrosis is considered sufficient to assign a diagnosis of Stage 3B even in the absence of visible pelvic wall involvement. This is a critical stage, as it signifies advanced local disease and affects management and prognosis, typically requiring definitive chemoradiation.

questions.text: Ovarian tumour with raised CA 125 and ascites and papillary excrescences and image
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Serous cystadenocarcinoma The image and clinical findings are characteristic of serous cystadenocarcinoma, the most common type of epithelial ovarian cancer. The gross pathology shows a multiloculated cystic mass with papillary projections (excrescences) on the surface. These surface excrescences are hallmark features of serous malignancies, particularly in high-grade serous carcinoma. Additional key features supporting this diagnosis: Raised CA-125: A tumor marker often elevated in epithelial ovarian cancers, especially serous types. Ascites: Commonly associated with peritoneal spread in ovarian carcinoma. Postmenopausal women are most often affected. Image shows solid and cystic areas with irregular papillary growths, typical of malignant serous tumors.

questions.text: 20 year old woman with irregular cycles concived with ivf with 2 months amenorrhea and lmp not known what is best parameter to know gestational age
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Crown rump length Crown Rump Length (CRL) is the most accurate and reliable parameter for determining gestational age during the first trimester (up to 13 weeks of gestation). In this case, the woman has 2 months (approximately 8 weeks) of amenorrhea, making her pregnancy fall within the first trimester. Additionally, her last menstrual period (LMP) is unknown, and cycles are irregular, making clinical dating unreliable. CRL directly measures the length of the embryo from the top of the head (crown) to the bottom of the buttocks (rump) using ultrasound. It is considered the gold standard for dating pregnancies in the first trimester, especially in cases of uncertain or unknown LMP. In IVF-conceived pregnancies, accurate dating is generally known, but if LMP is not available, CRL provides a dependable backup.

questions.text: 65 year with bleeding and the following is the hysterectomy specimen what is diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Endometrial cancer The image shows a gross hysterectomy specimen with the endometrial cavity opened. The endometrium appears irregular, friable, and thickened, with areas of necrosis and hemorrhage, all of which are classic features of endometrial carcinoma. This condition most commonly affects postmenopausal women (like the 65-year-old in this case) and presents typically with postmenopausal bleeding, a red-flag symptom for endometrial cancer. Endometrial carcinoma arises from the glandular epithelium lining the uterine cavity and is the most common gynecologic malignancy in developed countries. The diagnosis is supported by both clinical features and the appearance of the tumor replacing and destroying the normal endometrial architecture in the image.
